sleep_review:

REM looked light — reduce late-night screens and heavy food; light stretching and quiet reading can help. Tonight: finish caffeine by early afternoon, dim lights 60–90 minutes before bed, and park tomorrow's to‑dos on paper.
overnight_news: France remembers Bataclan attacks but knows enemy has not gone away - www.bbc.com. As France marks 10 years since the Paris attacks, an ex-girlfriend of a jihadist survivor is arrested for an alleged plot of her own.

Watch: Blue Origin rocket successfully lands booster during Mars mission launch - www.bbc.com. The booster powering New Glenn separated from the rocket's upper stage and successfully touched down on a landing pad in the Atlantic Ocean.

Disney eyes a future where users help shape the story - www.npr.org. Disney CEO Bob Iger said his company is talking with AI companies about allowing subscribers to create their own short-form videos on Disney+.

Swiss deploy charm offensive in bid to slash crippling Trump tariffs - www.bbc.com. Swiss business leaders appear to have made progress with a private initiative in which reports say they brought gifts to the Oval Office.

Germany agrees new military service plan to boost troop numbers - www.bbc.com. The new military service plan will mandate all 18-year-old men to fill out a questionnaire on their suitability to serve.

Federal special education staff may get their jobs back. But for how long? - www.npr.org. A new deal to end the government shutdown may briefly restore staff to U.S. Education Department offices that had been gutted by layoffs.
previous_day_news: Fossil fuel emissions rise again - but renewables boom offers hope for climate - www.bbc.com. Carbon emissions from burning fossil fuels are forecast to reach a new high in 2025 but could soon peak.
Kim Kardashian's shapewear brand Skims hits $5bn valuation - www.bbc.com. The company says it plans to open more physical shops and expand the business around the world.

The fallout from Nigeria's spectacular $25m museum and the Benin Bronzes - www.bbc.com. Nigeria’s stunning new Museum of West African Art (Mowaa) finds itself in the crosshairs of local power politics.
'There's a bit of anxiety': Stranger Things cast and creators on the show's end - www.bbc.com. After five seasons the show is coming to an end, but a spin-off is already in development.
The case for and against counting castes in India - www.bbc.com. A provocative new book warns that counting castes may entrench them further instead of dismantling the system.
Thirteen hours by touch – inside one of the world's longest exam days - www.bbc.com. South Korea's national college entry exam is notoriously hard - but blind students face unique challenges.
plans_placeholder: Wake, water, and 5–10 minutes of daylight
Deep work block (120–150 min) on the highest‑leverage task
Admin sweep: inbox zero in one 20‑minute pass
Second deep work block (60–90 min) to push one needle
Lunch away from desk; 10 minutes outside afterwards
Light coordination/outreach (30–45 min): one nudge that matters
Wrap‑up (20–30 min): log wins, plan tomorrow, park open loops
Evening: dim screens, low‑stress wind‑down, read 10 pages
good_word_of_advice: Protect the first hour; it sets the pace.
